Springfield, Illinois! I've got you covered.

Here are some scenic and relatively flat running routes in Springfield, Illinois, with varying distances, including a 10K route:

**Route 1: Lincoln Park Loop (3.5 miles, 5.6 km)**
Start at the Lincoln Park Pavilion and run along the park's perimeter, enjoying the scenic views of the lake and surrounding gardens. This route is mostly flat and has minimal traffic.

**Route 2: Washington Park Trail (5 miles, 8 km)**
Begin at the Washington Park Pavilion and follow the trail that takes you through the park's wooded areas and around the lake. This route is relatively flat and has some scenic views of the surrounding neighborhoods.

**Route 3: Lake Springfield Trail (6.2 miles, 10 km)**
Start at the Lake Springfield Marina and run along the lake's shoreline trail, which offers beautiful views of the lake and surrounding parks. This route is mostly flat and has minimal traffic.

**Route 4: Downtown Springfield Loop (8 miles, 12.9 km)**
Start at the Abraham Lincoln Presidential Library and Museum and run through the downtown area, passing by several historic landmarks, including the Illinois State Capitol building. This route has some gentle hills and moderate traffic.

**Route 5: Carpenter Park Trail (10 miles, 16.1 km)**
Begin at the Carpenter Park Nature Center and run along the trail that takes you through the park's wooded areas and along the Sangamon River. This route has some gentle hills and scenic views of the surrounding wetlands.

You can find these routes on MapMyRun or other route-finding tools by searching for the starting points and following the described routes. Make sure to stay hydrated, wear sunscreen, and run safely!

As you continue your marathon training, remember to:

* Gradually increase your mileage and intensity
* Incorporate speed workouts, hill repeats, and long runs into your training schedule
* Listen to your body and take rest days as needed
* Fuel your body with a balanced diet and stay hydrated

Feel free to ask if you have any questions or need more route recommendations!
